parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.
From philos and hippos; fond of horses; Philippus, the name of four Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Of Chaldee origin; fishing-house; Bethsaida, a place in Palestine.
Of Hebrew origin; Galiloea, a region of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Apparently from ereo; to interrogate; by implication, to request.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
